Fields.DialogueText: Captain! It feels like a month since I've last seen you!
Didn't we have dinner together yesterday?
HA! A whole 24 hours, is it? It's been too long.

Fields.MenuText: Are you feeling all right, Vendetta?
Has speaking with Jenkins for too long melted your mind?
Do you want something from me? Is that it?

Fields.DialogueText: Fit as a fiddle, Captain!
It will take a lot more mind-numbing conversation than that to melt this brain!
Captain! You assume a friendly hello is a ploy to get something in return?
Come on, spit it out.
Very well. You see right through me, don't you?
*ALARM*
I'll tell you everything after we defeat these Morganas.
@BATTLE
So, what was it you wanted to ask me?
We're going to dock soon, right?
I believe so. In a mile or two.
Perhaps you'd like to take a walk with me.
A walk of...
I can say with 99% certainty that no one will die on our outing. No matter what situation I'm in, considering that it's me we're dealing with, I always like to allot that final 1%.
You know me, Captain. I'm always ready for a tussle. But this time, I'm just looking for a regular walk.
I'm not asking you to go with Jenkins.
Just a walk.
Yep.
A regular, everyday walk.
Mhm!
Like... beside flowers and stuff?
If you like. What my Captain wants, my Captain gets!
... Sure?
Great! I'll go and pick out an outfit!
*ALARM*
I should probably take care of those Morganas first. I wouldn't want to get blood, oil, and shrapnel on a nice dress!
@BATTLE
I must admit, this is very pleasant.
HA! You see! I told you so!
Why exactly did you want to do this?
Actually, Captain, there's something I've been meaning to ask you.
What is it?
Whoa! Where's the fire!? Don't rush me, Captain, I'll get there when I get there.
I see. And will this arm interlocking of ours continue for the entire duration as well?
You can take my arm out if you like.
I didn't say THAT, but...
HA! I knew you liked it, you big softie.

Fields.MenuText: Is the UK as floral as this?

Fields.DialogueText: We have some wonderful gardens. You have to see them for yourself!

Fields.MenuText: Would we happen upon a nice day like this in the UK?

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, most definitely! It would just be hidden below a blanket of rain and grey. Kind of like me, in a way. You have to scratch beneath the surface to see the beauty!

Fields.MenuText: Did you hike back in the UK?

Fields.DialogueText: We've got mountains, though we're no Japan. Still, there are modest moors one can walk, which make for an interesting view.
*ALARM*
That was a big alarm. I can hear it all the way from here!
Let's head back. After we take out these Morganas, we can try the eastern route instead!
@BATTLE
What was life like as a destroyer during your infancy?
Every day was carnage. The good kind, though, so don't worry.
I noticed a few scars... if you don't mind me mentioning it? Er, that is...
Some of us, if our ships took fire in the old battles. They appeared when we did. Which one would you like to know about?

Fields.MenuText: The scar on the back of your neck.

Fields.DialogueText: That was in the Baltic. It was a horrendous battle. One of the hands took a pickle jar to the head when I pitched, and he hit the deck so hard he dented it!
HA! The Heligoland battle... that takes me back. We were ambushed and I caught the tail end of a stray shell on my deck. It only grazed me, but left a cruel reminder as to the frailty of life.
HA! That's recent. I enjoy collecting trophies from my enemies, but she had none! Luckily, Mistrust nicked me with one of those knives she keeps in her back. Now I have a trophy for life.
You've lived quite a life.
Indeed! Still, I'm coming to realize that, as each day passes, the chances only grow that I may one day breathe my final breath.
Don't talk like that, Vendetta.
Captain?
If you went anywhere, I don't think I'd be able to cope.
I see... Well, here we are. Back at the ship!
Are you ready to tell me what this was all about yet?
I spy some Morganas in the distance, Captain. What say we take them out first?
@BATTLE
I didn't know Belles could have scars.
Don't mind me, Captain. I wear these like trophies.
Come on. I'm sure each one tells a great story.
Aww, we're all that beautiful to you?
I've lived a fun life, but there's so much I've still yet to do.
I can't think of much you haven't done, to be honest...
My life sounds entertaining. But without someone like you, I'd have a million stories and no one to tell them to!
What are you saying?
*Inhale*
Vende--
Please go steady with me with intent to marry!
Wow... I was not expecting that.
What's your answer?
I'm not sure myself. I heard some youths talking about it as we passed by them earlier. I think it means serious dating.

Fields.MenuText: How long have you felt this way?

Fields.DialogueText: I didn't wake up one night and flick a switch inside myself! It's been gradual...

Fields.MenuText: I suppose that is one avenue you've never walked.

Fields.DialogueText: And I'd like to try to one day...
It's rude to keep a lady waiting, Captain. Especially when I picked out this outfit especially for the occasion.
I... I... I'd love to, Vendetta.
You mean it?
If you'll have me.
HA! Captain!
Whoa, whoa, whoa, Vendetta don't hug me so MUU--
*WHUD*
So, do I need to buy you a ring or...?
Captain, I'm not that kind of girl. Although if you did happen to have a spare diamond lying around, I wouldn't say no.
*ALARM*
HA! Our first battle as betrothed! Try to keep up, Captain, I can't spend the rest of my life looking back at you!
@BATTLE
Captain! I've prepared your meal.
Thanks, Vendetta, but don't we usually eat in the mess hall?
I thought we could have dinner together. Seeing as... you know.
It's rare to see you so flustered.
I think I expunged most of my confidence in that proposal. Forgive me; it may take a few days to recover.
I'd love to have dinner. What have you prepared?
It's a signature British dish! Care to have a guess?
That would be the most famous UK dish, but it's hardly the most elegant! Fish and chips are often wrapped in newspaper, for goodness' sake!
A great guess, but a tad too time consuming.
I do love scones, but brunch is usually reserved for casual acquaintances, not betrothed couples!
What is it, then?
Ta-da!
W...what is this?
Beans on toast! A classic!
Uhh...
*Sigh* To be honest, Captain, we have very few supplies on board. Combine that with my lack of cooking prowess and this is the best I can do.
It looks wonderful, Vendetta. Shall we tuck in?
*ALARM*
Ooh! Just in time! We're out of bacon, but I can sure sprinkle some Morgana meat onto your meal!
On second thoughts, maybe I'll pass on dinner...
@BATTLE
How are you enjoying the meal, Captain?
It's much better than I expected!
I'll take that as a compliment!
Do you enjoy cooking?
Not particularly. But like I mentioned before, when exploring a new avenue I like to see all the sights, not make a beeline for the exit.
I'll have to make something for you next time.
HA! I'll be waiting!
*BOOM*

Fields.MenuText: Excuse me! These beans have gone right through me!

Fields.DialogueText: It came from upstairs!
Morganas!?
That wasn't your backside, Captain!
*ALARM*
Quickly, to the deck! Let's see what all this commotion is about!
@BATTLE
They're gaining on us, Captain! We can't outrun them!
Navigation's on it! There's a depot nearby where we can recover our losses!
There's a few stragglers still on our tail! Grr... this isn't going to be pretty.
Vendetta, wait!
Don't tell me not to go, Captain! I told you, I can't be held back by--
@BATTLE
I love it when you talk dirty to me!
And I you, Captain! Now get to safety or I'll kill you myself!
*BOOM*
Captain! I'm about to get especially violent. Get to safety on land! I'll take them out quickly and rendezvous with you later!
This isn't right. How did I let Vendetta talk me off of my own ship?
Maybe I'm not coming back. You left me to fight your battle and now I've perished in the sea somewhere.
No, the REAL Vendetta would never give up so easily.
How much do you know about the REAL Vendetta? I am a destroyer, after all. I'm fated to die in battle.
No! You're putting words in my mouth!
Hey, I'm just a manifestation of your subconscious. Deep down, you must be thinking this a little for me to say it.

Fields.MenuText: She said she wouldn't throw her life away so easily.

Fields.DialogueText: She's doing all this to protect you.
What are you saying?
I'm saying that if she does return, make sure we're never put in this position again.

Fields.MenuText: She said she had something to live for...

Fields.DialogueText: You don't give her something to live for just by existing. You give her something to live for by putting time into your relationship.

Fields.MenuText: She said she'd never leave me.

Fields.DialogueText: Now you just sound co-dependent.
She's right. Men! Do you spy those Morganas scouting our location!? We can't have Vendetta do all the work to ensure our survival! Coastal defense stations, now!
@BATTLE
... And when is she coming back?
I think... is that... I see her! On the horizon!
Captain!
*BOOF*
As aggressive a hug as ever!
Captain! Thank goodness you're safe!
Hey, that's my line!
HA! Don't look at me, Captain, the salty water appears to have made me teary-eyed!
Vendetta, you're a master at strategy games, correct?
Well, enough to beat you. But that isn't saying much.
Painful insult aside, could you try tapping into the strategic mindset? Maybe you can help us think of a way out of here?
I can try...
Vendetta, what do you think of this plan I drew up?
AH! It's almost foolproof, Captain, but you failed to navigate our escape route. If we follow along this line here, we should be able to avoid most of the Morganas.

Fields.MenuText: I didn't even see that route! Very impressive!
Wow, this tactical side is really putting in work!
Can we have this Vendetta all the time?

Fields.DialogueText: AH! You are mistaken, Captain. I haven't truly gone anywhere. We're one and the same.
Loose lips sink ships and tired eyes will be your demise.
It didn't sprout from nothing, Captain. I have a wealth of experiences to draw inspiration from.
Okay, men, you heard the girl! We're heading back out into the fleet and we're going to take them all out in one fell swoop!
Aye-aye!
@BATTLE
*SHORTLY THEREAFTER*
The plan isn't working, Captain! We underestimated their numbers!
The smokescreen I suggested is providing ample room for manoeuvres, but by the time it wears off, we'll have no cover left to use your escape route!
This is too dangerous, Captain! Let's retreat!
What are you talking about!?
I can't risk losing you! Not again!
Vendetta! You said you didn't want me holding you back! Being tactical doesn't mean being cowardly and being aggressive doesn't mean switching your brain off!
... You're right.

Fields.MenuText: Show them what you're made of!

Fields.DialogueText: AHA! I can see a path that will allow me to start a chain reaction! By destroying the largest ship, the resulting explosion will cause the others to fall like dominos!
Brains and brawn. Is there anything you can't do?
AHA! Stand back, Captain. Depending on your personal preferences, this display is either going to be a huge turn-off or scintillatingly exciting!
@BATTLE
And it certainly doesn't mean sticking your captain on an island while you do all the fighting!
That looks to be the last of them. And the smoke from all the explosions is masking our escape from any reinforcements rather well.
Vendetta... I... That was...
I see now that I can function just as well utilizing my strategic knowledge alongside my destructive capabilities. You helped me see that, Captain.
It was certainly something to behold.
AHA! I'll take that as a compliment.

Fields.MenuText: Do you need to take a break now?

Fields.DialogueText: AHA! A scar or two doesn't faze me, Captain. I simply add it to the collection.
I did manage to swipe this necklace from the leader. What do you think? Does it suit me?
No rest for the wicked! Although you may need a quick lie down, Captain.
I'm just glad you're still standing.
Captain, what say we get away for a spell?
Get away?
A couple's retreat!
Some rest and relaxation? That sounds like exactly what I need!
Perhaps those Morganas in the distance can offer some travel guidance! I'll ask for some recommendations!
@BATTLE
Isn't this lovely, Captain? This is just what I needed!
When you said "romantic getaway" I was thinking Paris...
If we're together, everywhere can be Paris! Take a seat, I've prepared lunch!
I suppose the blistering heat is kind of like a sauna...
AHA! That's the spirit, Captain! And, might I say, the way the light reflects off the steel pipes makes you look even better than usual!
Thanks... I think...
Dig in! Don't be shy!

Fields.MenuText: So, would you take time for yourself under regular circumstances?

Fields.DialogueText: Without you? Probably not. Self-care has never been a priority of mine. With as many sisters as I have, their needs always come first. It's become an ingrained notion for me.

Fields.MenuText: Do you have any idea what you want to do after the war?

Fields.DialogueText: I'm torn between staying in Australia or returning to the UK. I love them both, but I think in the end I'll probably give up on both and return to wherever Vimiera is stationed.
Is that so? The grimace on your face says otherwise... Here, have some more if you like it so much! And make sure to smile this time!
I noticed you've been writing in your notebooks less and less nowadays.
On the contrary! I've been writing more than ever. It's just... Well, I used to write in your presence seeing as I didn't care if you caught a glimpse...
But...?
But, now we're betrothed, it feels kind of... embarrassing to have that much of myself exposed.
I'm not following.
AHA! Trust me, Captain, you're a long way from understanding the complexities of my heart.
*ALARM*
I at least know one thing. If Morganas come a-knocking...?
Then Vendetta is docking!
@BATTLE
Vendetta, how are things?
Captain! I wasn't writing about you!
*THUD*
Let me get that. What's this?
It's definitely not your personalized notebook that, after our chat the other day, I haven't been expanding upon!
It's already open and I've spotted a few words. Mind if I take look?
*Sigh* I don't think I have much choice at this point.
Wow, there really is a lot.
On second thought, Captain, this is too much even for me! It's like you pawing through my unmentionables! Give it to me and tell me which portion you'd like to hear about.
"I'm finally starting to settle into my new surroundings thanks in part to the Captain. The strictness chafes a bit, but I'm wise enough to see it is for the greater good."
"Things have been progressing much faster than I expected. At this rate, we'll be married with children before the war is over!"
"I enjoy spending time with the Captain and appreciate the slower pace we're taking. Although there is such a thing as too slow... I never knew the Captain was so glacial..."
Wow... you really have me down to the letter, don't you?
What can I say? I'm a woman of many talents.
*ALARM*
Speaking of which, let me demonstrate one of them to you right now!
@BATTLE
Captain! Good day to you. How are things?
What do you want, Jenkins?
Sharp as ever, I see! I'm wondering if you could hold this bucket of mop water over the door for me.
Whatever for?
I'm worried there may be a hole in the bottom, but I need both hands to check and someone to hold it up to the light.
And you thought it proper to ask the most senior officer aboard to help you with such a mundane task?
I know my captain is a friend to the people, after all.
Very well, give it here. Like this?
Perfect! While I have you, how are things with Vendetta?
Of course. It also wasn't appropriate for her to pin me down and twist my arm for snooping through her notebooks again, but I can forgive and forget.
Is that so? My legs weren't fine after Vendetta had me stand on deck for 24 hours after ACCIDENTALLY taking one of her trinkets.
SOMETHING is thinking you're being made to walk the plank only to find yourself face down in a soapy bucket. That Vendetta is certainly SOMETHING, all right...
Oh! Would you look at the time! Captain, I'll be right back, I just have to... polish the rudders.
Wait, Jenkins! Come back!
Captain? Are you in here? Jenkins told me you wanted to see me?
Wait, Vendetta, don't open the door!
*SPLOOSH*
Vendetta... This isn't what it looks like...
*ALARM*
HA! Perchance you'd care to explain it to me on the battlefield.
"HA?" Only "HA?" What happened to the tactical "AH?"
Let's just say I'm feeling a little more destructive than usual right now.
@BATTLE
For the last time, I'm telling you it was Jenkins! The little blighter set me up!
I do find it hard to believe you could pull off something that ingenious, Captain. You're too proper to think of something that devilish.
Hey, I have a dark side too...
Oh, really? In that case, would you like to prove it?
How so?
Jenkins pranked me and left you to take the fall. If that's not the recipe for revenge, then I don't know what is.
I did say I was going to teach you how to cook...
Revenge is like a butterfly, Captain. Hold it too tightly and you'll crush it. Too loosely, and it flies away.

Fields.MenuText: I think that analogy is meant for love...

Fields.DialogueText: That can't be right. You always complain that my hugs have broken your bones and we're more in love than ever!
As a Brit, poetry runs through my blood!
Ugh! Let me spell it out for you!
I'm still not following.
AHA! But you will be. Very shortly. You will be following Jenkins with me as we conduct surveillance.
For what purpose?
Why do you think I'm so successful in battle? Why do I have all these trophies? I took the time to study my opponent and learn their habits, their weaknesses! Then you can strike with precision.
*ALARM*
Allow me to demonstrate, Captain. There's a reason why other Belles liken me to the Morgana "Wrath."
@BATTLE
Wow, you really weren't kidding when you said you knew your way around a Morgana.
It isn't just being able to sink a Morgana, Captain. How much do you even know about the enemy you're fighting?

Fields.MenuText: I know there's a lot of them?

Fields.DialogueText: That's a very subjective statement, Captain.
There's a lot of us as well, from their perspective. It's all about perspective.
Huh? I never noticed that until now.
What are you trying to say?
Try, for a moment, not to think of the Morganas as otherworldly entities, devoid of emotion and fixated on destruction.
Oh, good lord...
What do you see? A Morgana without black smoke, and a cannon aimed at your head.
Don't take this the wrong way, Vendetta but... I see you.
Why do you think I'm able to so expertly flank these Morganas each time we battle? I know exactly the way I would move in their situation, so I merely have to move to counterattack.
I see. I've always thought of the Morganas as nothing more than target dummies for my beat stick.
You don't have to like your enemy to respect their intelligence and decision making. Only a fool underestimates their opponent.
You're right. It may be tricky for me to gain such experience mid-battle. What say I expand my knowledge of combat tactics by showing Jenkins what for?
Follow my lead, Captain. I'll tell you everything you need to know.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
So, Captain, what have you noticed about Jenkins so far? Take a look over your shoulder again, but try to do it covertly.
He's eating...
And?
Drinking...
Oh, boy... Okay, first things first; whenever I plan to take on a Morgana, I have to study their movements.

Fields.MenuText: You're really studious when it comes to war.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm not just a pretty face, Captain. Although, feel free to refer to me as such.

Fields.MenuText: How long do you recommend studying before initiating combat?

Fields.DialogueText: It depends on the target. Some Morganas show their whole hands from the get-go. Others keep their cards close to their chest and weeks may elapse before I'm confident enough to take them on.

Fields.MenuText: Does Jenkins require this much thought? I mean... it's Jenkins...

Fields.DialogueText: "Here, I'll give you the first hit for free anywhere you like." Famous last words of an overconfident man.
He's getting up to leave!
*ALARM*
Damn! You tail him while I handle these Morganas. We'll rendezvous later!
@BATTLE
Captain, the Morganas have been dealt with. What did I miss?
Nothing much. Jenkins came down here and he's been writing in what looks to be a notebook ever since.
A notebook? It isn't one of mine, is it?
No, it's a bright pink color as opposed to your white and black variants.
Interesting...

Fields.MenuText: What do you think he could be writing?
Has he always had a penchant for writing?
How long do you think he's been coming down here to do this?

Fields.DialogueText: It's Jenkins. It could be literally anything!
I must admit, I've taken very little interest in Jenkins's personal life over the years. For all I know, Jenkins could be a pen name and he's really Virginia Woolf!
Judging by how far he's writing into the book, it looks like he's been doing this for some time.
Wait, what is he doing?
He's hiding it between the pipes.
*ALARM*
Quickly, Captain, let's grab the book and meet back at your quarters!
@BATTLE
It looks like there's some kind of lock on the book.
We'll need to break it open, discover his weakness, and formulate a revenge plan.
I have some tools in my desk, bear with me.
How do you feel about my methods, Captain?

Fields.MenuText: I'm glad you're on MY side.

Fields.DialogueText: I don't mean to overstep any boundaries by informing you about things you already know. Still, I feel all of us have a degree for growth that will subsist until our dying breath.
AHA! There's no time for niceties on the battefield, Captain!
AHA! I'm glad you know how quickly things will turn sour if you ever betray me!
*ALARM*
Blasted Morganas! Captain, with me!
@BATTLE
Got it!
Excellent work, Captain. Now feel free to read over exactly what he's been saying.
It's sectioned into parts.
Read what you think will be the most relevant to our revenge plan.
Please, go ahead.
Please, go ahead.
Please, go ahead.
"... I work all damn day just to have the rest of the crew berate me! You doze off at the wheel ONE TIME and suddenly you're a threat to everyone's lives."
"... What I wouldn't give to see her face again. My love, my muse. Oh, my golden brown, sweet and delectable... Mars Bar."
"I still can't believe I made it aboard a ship. I wanted to be a baker!"
Why don't you read what he was writing about today?
*ALARM*
Good idea! After we take care of these Morganas, let's do just that.
@BATTLE
Okay, Captain! Please feel free to read.
*ALARM*
Damn Morganas! Can't they see I'm busy!
@BATTLE
Please read it to yourself, Captain! I'll keep watch.
"Vendetta has been extra annoying recently. It's about time I teach her a lesson."
"I'm going to have the Captain hold a bucket over... Why am I explaining this. You already know everything, don't you, Captain?"
"You tried your best to get into my head, but it is I who outfoxed you!"
"Is that what you expected me to say? Oh, Captain. This goes much higher than you could ever possibly imagine."
"Head to the deck."

Fields.MenuText: This doesn't feel like an infringement on his privacy?

Fields.DialogueText: No captain of mine falters within striking distance of the prey!
All right, all right...

Fields.MenuText: Thank goodness it's English. I thought he would have come up with some harebrained code.

Fields.DialogueText: I thought he was learning hieroglyphics at one point, but he was just really taken with birds that day.
... Really, really taken. Like, to an uncomfortable--
Jenkins? What's going on?
Captain! I believe that belongs to me.

Fields.MenuText: You knew we were following you?

Fields.DialogueText: Don't worry, Captain. You see those Morganas? Our first priority is to take them out!
@BATTLE
The way those Morganas explode... It looks almost like fireworks, don't you think?
So are you planning on paying Vendetta and I back for our revenge scheme?
Oh, very much so. My revenge is right behind you. Take a look.
Vendetta? What...? Why...?
Captain... Will you marry me?
What, indeed.
I've always wanted to say that.
Of course you have.
How the turn tables.
Wait, I mean--
When you're in a hole, stop digging.
My head is about to explode. As your captain, I demand you two explain yourselves right now!
It's simple, Captain. Haven't you been listening to anything I've been saying to you recently?
Clearly not!
You need to track your target. Learn their movements and prepare to strike. That's what I've been doing with you all this time.
So, the water bucket?
It was the first step of my surprise proposal. Jenkins was rather cooperative.
I'm only looking for one word here, Captain.

Fields.MenuText: I already agreed to marry you.

Fields.DialogueText: You consider a confession of love without a ring a proposal? Come on, Captain, give me more credit than that!

Fields.MenuText: That Jenkins is in for a hiding.

Fields.DialogueText: Jenkins can wait.
Do you have any answer, Captain? My knee is starting to hurt from leaning down on it. If you're going to take the ring please do so quickly.
Well... I--
*ALARM*
Can't think straight with that alarm blaring. Don't move, Vendetta! I'll be right back!
@BATTLE
I'll go blind if I keep looking at this stone. How much did this ring you set you back? It's bigger than my head!
You can't ask that question, Captain! It's rude!
Very well.
I just realized... I never thought I'd get this far... WE HAVE SO MUCH PLANNING TO DO!
Planning?
We'll need to order a caterer, invite my sisters. Maybe we can skip out on Vimiera's invite and dine with her another time. Lord knows she'll cause some kind of havoc. A cake, a dress. Anything else?
Right! Even Jenkins, I suppose. Without him, this would never have been possible.
That can wait! I need to make sure my Captain is looking good first, don't I?
Ugh! I'm not good with words. Perhaps we can brainstorm together?
Captain, the ring looks great on you.
You think?
I never thought I'd live to see the day where a middle-aged destroyer like myself could find happiness. You gave that to me, Captain, and I'll never forget it.
Don't talk as if everything's over yet, Vendetta. Our journey's only just begun!
AHA! Aye-aye, Captain!
I appreciate you not staying on one knee for the whole battle.
Love's blind, but it isn't suicidal!
